Hello World! Lets talk about…

For a long time, mental health has been an issue that has been avoided and misunderstood by the entire world. In a bid to raise the awareness and test people\'s knowledge, we request you to take our short survey. Thank you!
Did you know…?
Every 1 in 4 people in the world will have some form of mental problem at some point in their lives. Based on the world\'s population, around 450 million people currently have mental problems.
In fact, data from the WHO shows that depression will be the main cause of disability in the world by the year 2020.
Common disorders include: ->Depression ->Most kinds of phobias ->Schizophrenia ->Bipolar disorder ->Autism ->Anxiety and panic ->Post-traumatic stress
In most countries, people with mental problems or challenges have their rights constantly abused and violated. Thousands of such cases are reported to the authorities every year.

Low income states do not have enough personnel or resources to assist people with mental challenges. Data shows that there are 0.05 psychiatrists and 0.42 nurses per every 100 people in these nations. In addition, Less than 2% of the health budget is allocated to tackling mental disorders.
People who reside in war-torn and unstable regions are in greater risk of developing mental problems.This is especially true for children.
